Sudhakar Subudhi

Professor at IIT Roorkee

About

Sudhakar Subudhi, a distinguished Professor in the field of mechanical engineering, has made significant contributions that have left an indelible mark. His research interests span across Natural and Forced convection, Natural Ventilation, Unconventional energy systems, Nanofluids, and the Thermoregulatory mechanism of the human body. Dr. Subudhi's educational journey is characterized by academic excellence. Throughout his career, Dr. Subudhi has contributed significantly to the understanding of natural ventilation and heat transfer, shedding light on unconventional energy systems and the application of nanofluids. His research has provided valuable insights into the thermoregulation of the human body. Dr. Subudhi's work continues to influence the field of mechanical engineering, making him a notable figure in academia and research.

Research Interest

Natural and Forced convection, Natural Ventilation, Unconventional energy systems, Nanofluids, Thermoregulatory mechanism of human body
